The durability of the two leggings is added together, plus an extra 5% durability.
The durability of the two leggings are added together, plus an extra 5% durability.

Wear a full suit of Iron Armor.
Use a cauldron to dye all 4 unique pieces of leather armor.
Wear a full set of Netherite armor
Have a full set of Netherite armor in your inventory.
Give a piglin a gold item while it is aggressive toward the player.
Protect yourself with a piece of iron armor
Have any type of iron armor in your inventory.
Have any type of diamond armor in your inventory.

Give a piglin one of these 24 gold-related items in the #piglin_loved item tag, while not wearing any golden armor:
Bell Block of Gold Block of Raw Gold Clock Enchanted Golden Apple Gilded Blackstone Glistering Melon Slice Gold Ingot Gold Ore Golden Apple Golden Axe Golden Boots Golden Carrot Golden Chestplate Golden Helmet Golden Hoe Golden Horse Armor Golden Leggings Golden Pickaxe Golden Shovel Golden Sword Light Weighted Pressure Plate Nether Gold Ore Deepslate Gold Ore Raw Gold
If this advancement is attempted while the player is wearing golden armor but piglin(s) remain aggressive, the advancement does not trigger. Other gold-related items, if any, do not distract the piglin and do not trigger this advancement.
Get a full suit of Netherite armor
Have a full set of netherite armor in your inventory.
Leather-chain leggings are now able to be seen in the inventory.
Notch revealed new models for armor, which included leggings.
Leggings models are now displayed on the player in the inventory.[more information needed]
Added cloth leggings, which have been given the textures from one of Notch's previous games, Legend of the Chambered.
Leggings can now be crafted and worn.
Leggings now function, giving 6 (). Leggings have limited durability, with lower tier leggings less durable than higher tier leggings.
"Wool leggings" have been renamed to "leather leggings".[verify]
Leather pants are now crafted with leather instead of wool.

The armor protection behavior has been changed. Previous to this update, the total armor protection is based in this equation: (((total equipped armor damage reduction − 1) × (all equipped armor max damage − total equipped armor damage)) ÷ (total equipped armor max damage + 1)).
The first images of a player wearing enchanted armor, including leggings, are revealed.
Iron leggings can now be found in the new stronghold altar chests.
Iron leggings can now be found in the new blacksmith chests in villages.
⇧ Shift+clicking can now be used to equip leggings.
Chain leggings can now be obtained legitimately in survival mode through trading.
Blacksmith villagers now sell chain leggings for 9–10 emeralds.
Blacksmith villagers now sell diamond leggings for 11–13 emeralds.
Blacksmith villagers now sell iron leggings for 8–9 emeralds.
Butchers now sell leather pants for 2–3 emeralds.
Mob armor has been reintroduced. A partial or full set of any armor is now sometimes worn by zombies, skeletons and zombie pigmen, with the likelihood increasing with difficulty.
Jeb and Dinnerbone tweeted pictures of dyeable leather armor, including leggings.
Leather pants can now be dyed by crafting leather pants with dyes. Dyes can be removed by using dyed leather pants on a cauldron with water.
Default leather pants are now slightly darker.
Dyed leather pants are now more saturated and have a slight tint of tan in respect to the default armor color.
Wither skeletons can now spawn wearing leggings.
[more information needed] Leather leggings now have non-dyed parts. This has been implemented so that players can distinguish between other types of armor and similarly colored leather armor.
Leather pants now have knee pads, which has changed the texture from to .
Leggings in the player's hand can now be equipped by right-clicking.
Dispensers can now equip nearby players with leggings.
Armorer villagers now sell chain leggings for 9–11 emeralds.
Armorer villagers no longer sell diamond leggings.
Armorer villagers no longer sell iron leggings.
Leatherworkers now sell leather pants for 2–4 emeralds.
Leggings no longer turn red when mobs and players are hurt.
Leggings are now visible on giants.
Chain leggings can no longer be crafted anymore due to the item form of fire being removed.
Enchanted iron and diamond leggings can now be found in end city ship chests.
Mobs now wear armor from the bottom to the top, rather than from the top to the bottom. This means that a mob with three armor pieces, for example, spawn with all armor except a helmet.
Leggings' durability now affects armor value.
Armor value and armor enchantment calculations have been changed. For the original values, see here.
Leggings' durability affecting value has been removed.
Leggings now have an attribute controlling the defense points.
Armor value and armor enchantment calculations have been changed again.
Armor value calculations have been changed, once again.
Golden, chain, and iron leggings can now be smelted down into one of their respective nuggets. Chain leggings smelt into iron nuggets.
Prior to The Flattening, these items' numeral IDs were 300 (Leather), 304 (Chainmail), 308 (Iron), 312 (Diamond), and 316 (Golden).
Enchanted leather pants can now generate in the chests of shipwrecks.
Chain leggings have been renamed to "chainmail leggings".
The textures of leather leggings have been changed.
The textures of chainmail leggings have been changed.
The textures of iron leggings have been changed.
The textures of gold leggings have been changed.
The textures of diamond leggings have been changed.
Leather pants can now be found in chests in village tanneries.
The texture of gold leggings items have been changed.
Armorer villagers now sell iron and enchanted diamond leggings, making diamond leggings effectively renewable again.
Leather pants sold by leatherworker villagers are now randomly dyed.
Armorer villagers now give chainmail leggings to players under the Hero of the Village effect.
Netherite leggings can be crafted using one diamond leggings and one netherite ingot.
The textures of diamond leggings items have been changed.
The texture of netherite leggings have been changed.
Netherite leggings can no longer be crafted.
Netherite leggings are now obtained by combining one diamond leggings and one netherite ingot in a smithing table.
Netherite leggings now generate randomly enchanted in bastion remnant chests.
Golden leggings now generate randomly enchanted in ruined portal chests.
Diamonds leggings now generate in place of netherite leggings in bastion remnant chests.
The texture of netherite leggings has been changed.
Netherite leggings knockback resistance is no longer random.
Added the Swift Sneak enchantment, which can only be applied to leggings.
Iron and Diamond Leggings may now be found in ancient city chests.
The leather pants sprites have been changed to that of the PC version, but its armor model remains that of older versions.
Iron leggings now naturally generates in village chests and a stronghold altar chest.
Armor now protects against damage from mobs only.
Leggings can now be worn by mobs.
Leggings no longer turns red when mobs and players are hurt.
Chainmail leggings can now be obtained in survival mode from a mob wearing it.
Leather armor can now be dyed and the model has been updated.
Leggings can now be obtained from strays and husks that naturally spawn with armor.
Capes no longer clip through armor.
Enchanted iron leggings and enchanted diamond leggings can now be found inside chests within end city.
Chainmail leggings are now sold by armorer smith villagers via trading.
Golden, chain and iron leggings can now be smelted down into one of their respective nuggets.
Chainmail leggings now generate in buried treasure chests.
Enchanted leather leggings can now be found inside shipwreck supply room chests.
Iron leggings now can be found in plains village weaponsmith chests.
Leather pants can now be found inside plains village tannery chests.
The textures of leather pants have been changed.
The textures of chainmail leggings have been changed.
The textures of iron leggings have been changed.
The textures of golden leggings have been changed.
The textures of diamond leggings have been changed.
Iron leggings now can be found in savanna, taiga, desert, snowy taiga and snowy tundra village weaponsmith chests.
Leather leggings can now be found inside savanna, taiga, desert, snowy taiga and snowy tundra village tannery chests.
Pillagers and vindicators that spawn in raids can now drop iron leggings.
Leather pants are now sold by leather worker villagers.
Iron leggings and diamond leggings are now sold by armorer villagers.
The textures of golden leggings items have been changed.
Leather armor no longer show as being dyed properly when worn by armor stands.
Leather armor now appears dyed properly when worn by armor stands.
Netherite leggings can be crafted using one diamond leggings and one netherite ingot.
The texture of diamond leggings has been changed.
Golden leggings can now be obtained from piglins wearing armor.
Netherite leggings can no longer be crafted.
Netherite leggings are now obtained by combining one diamond leggings and one netherite ingot in a smithing table.
Golden leggings can now be found in ruined portal chests.
Golden and netherite leggings can now be found in bastion remnant chests.
Diamonds leggings now generate in place of netherite leggings in bastion remnant chests.
The texture of netherite leggings has been changed.
Added a quick equip for armor to the inventory interface.
The textures for leather armor items have been changed.
Leather armor can now be dyed.
Item repair can now repair armor.
Armor now have the quick equip functionality.
Golden, chain and iron armor can now be smelted down into one of their respective nuggets.
The textures of leather armor have been changed.
The textures of chainmail armor have been changed.
The textures of iron armor have been changed.
The textures of gold armor have been changed.
The textures of diamond armor have been changed.

images.alt_text: Armor Stand with Leather Armor MCPE-44669

texts.text: Leggings are a type of armor that covers the lower body of the player. There are six types of leggings: leather pants[a], chainmail leggings, iron leggings, diamond leggings, gold leggings and netherite leggings.

1 Obtaining
1.1 Crafting
1.2 Upgrading
1.3 Repairing
1.3.1 Grinding
1.3.2 Unit repair
1.4 Mob loot
1.5 Chest loot
1.6 Trading
2 Usage
2.1 Defense points
2.2 Durability
2.2.1 Repair
2.3 Enchantments
2.4 Smelting usage
2.5 Piglins
3 Data values
3.1 ID
3.2 Item data
4 Achievements
5 Advancements
6 History
7 Issues
8 Gallery
8.1 Enchanted Leggings
9 Notes
10 References
Leggings can be repaired in an anvil by adding units of the armor material's repair material, with each repair material restoring 25% of the leggings' maximum durability, rounded down.

If a zombie, piglin, zombie pigman or skeleton is wearing armor, there is an 8.5% chance (9.5% with Looting I, 10.5% with Looting II and 11.5% with Looting III) for the mob to drop leggings upon death. The leggings are usually badly damaged and may be enchanted.
Vindicators and Pillagers spawn in raids have a chance to drop iron leggings, which are usually badly damaged, and may be enchanted.
All enchantments are equally probable, including treasure enchantments (except Soul Speed), and any level of the enchantment is equally probable.

Enchantment probabilities are the same as a level-20 to level-39 enchantment would be on an enchantment table that had no cap at level 30, and that was able to apply treasure enchantments (except Soul Speed), and where the chance of multiple enchantments is not reduced.
The item has between 80% and 100% of its total durability.

In Java Edition, novice-level armorer villagers have a 40% chance to sell iron leggings for 7 emeralds. Apprentice-level armorer villagers have a 50% chance to sell chainmail leggings for 3 emeralds. Expert-level armorer villagers always sell enchanted diamond leggings for 18-35 emeralds. Novice-level leatherworker villagers have a 2⁄3 chance to sell randomly dyed[note 1] leather pants for 3 emeralds.
Armorer villagers may give the players with the Hero of the Village effect chainmail leggings. ‌[Java Edition only]

In Bedrock Edition, novice-level armorer villagers have a 25% chance of selling iron leggings for 7 emeralds. Apprentice-level armorers have a 1⁄3 chance to sell chainmail leggings for 3 emeralds. Expert-level armorers have a 50% chance to sell enchanted diamond leggings for 14 emeralds. Novice-level leatherworker villagers have 50% chance to sell leather pants for 3 emeralds.
The leather armor has a random color created by two dyes (possibly the same dye twice).
Leggings can be placed in the 3rd armor slot of a player's inventory for activation.

Defense points are each signified by half of a shirt of mail in the armor bar above the health bar. Each defense point reduces any damage dealt to the player that is absorbed by armor by 4%, increasing additively with the number of defense points. Different materials and combinations of armor provide different levels of defense.
The following table shows the number of defense points added by leggings.
The following table shows the amount of damage each piece of armor can absorb before being destroyed.

Any "hit" from a damage source that can be blocked by armor removes one point of durability from each piece of armor worn for every 4 of incoming damage (rounded down, but never below 1). Damage taken but not protected by that armor (such as falling or drowning) does not damage the armor, even if it is enchanted to protect against that type of damage. The following chart displays how many hits leggings can endure.
Netherite armor is not damaged by lava or fire when worn.

Leggings may be repaired on an anvil by combining them with their corresponding crafting material (leather, gold ingots, iron ingots, diamonds, or netherite ingots), and any enchantments are retained. Chainmail leggings may be repaired in this way with iron ingots. Leggings may also be repaired by crafting them together with another pair of leggings of the same material, although enchantments are lost.
Leggings can receive the following enchantments:
Fire Protection, Blast Protection, Projectile Protection and Protection are mutually exclusive
Only from using an anvil and enchanted books.
Only from chest loot, fishing, or an anvil and enchanted books.

Piglins are attracted to golden leggings and pick them up, examining them for 6 to 8 seconds. Piglins can wear other leggings but are not attracted to them. They prefer stronger leggings over weaker leggings, with one exception: They always prefer golden leggings over all other leggings, throwing out stronger leggings to in favor of gold leggings. Enchanted leggings are preferred over unenchanted leggings.
When leather pants are dyed, it has the following NBT:

tag: Parent tag.
 display: Display properties.
 color: The color of the leather armor. The tooltip displays "Dyed" if advanced tooltips are disabled, otherwise it displays the hexadecimal color value. Color codes are calculated from the Red, Green and Blue components using this formula:
Red<<16 + Green<<8 + Blue[1]
Issues relating to "Leggings" are maintained on the bug tracker. Report issues there.
Known as leather trousers in British English variant.‌[Java Edition only]
For positive values larger than 0x00FFFFFF, the top byte is ignored. All negative values produce white.
